sourceText: Prose Edda (Snorri Sturluson); Poetic Edda; Gylfaginning; Voluspa
note: The nine worlds of Yggdrasil mapped to planetary correspondences via the Norse-weekday god system. Asgard (Sun) at the crown, descending through the realms to Helheim (Saturn). Three additional worlds extend beyond Saturn — Niflheim, Muspelheim, and Ginnungagap — with suggested modern planet correspondences (Uranus, Neptune, Pluto) in parentheses. God archetypes follow the weekday associations: Sunday/Sol, Monday/Mani, Tuesday/Tyr, Wednesday/Odin, Thursday/Thor, Friday/Freya, Saturday/Saturn-figure.

Asgard.realm: Asgard — realm of the Aesir gods
Asgard.description: Divine order above — law, prophecy, and cosmic motion
Asgard.godArchetype: Radiant sovereign, timekeeper of fate, presence — not dominant

Alfheim.realm: Alfheim — realm of the light elves
Alfheim.description: Beauty, grace, spiritual brightness, ethereal vision, and inspiration
Alfheim.godArchetype: Hidden knowledge, wisdom, travel between worlds — psychopomp

Vanaheim.realm: Vanaheim — realm of the Vanir gods
Vanaheim.description: Fertile, peaceful, nature — gentle, harmonious, regenerative, prosperity, sensual, foresight

Jotunheim.description: Opposition, chaos, challenge, and elemental land
Jotunheim.godArchetype: Warrior — courage, defense of truth, not rage, more so integrity

Svartalfheim.description: Master smiths beneath the surface, shaping reality — the craft and the depth
Svartalfheim.godArchetype: Champion, thunder, fertility — benevolent cosmic protector

Helheim.description: Death of natural causes, ruled by Hel — quiet dissolution and stillness, the forgotten dead, silence
Helheim.godArchetype: Ancient progenitor, first being of flesh

Niflheim.description: Source of rivers beneath the roots, inertia and memory — serpents, ice, entropy, and deep time

Muspelheim.description: Flame, movement, cataclysmic power — fire giants, creation and destruction, clashing of world forces and formations
